windows.symptom: Network Adapter Issues        So Ive had my computer for a little more than a year now and it was doing fine. However, these past few days Ive run into several issues with my network adapter. As time has went on, it has gotten to the point where i can no longer find my network adapter in my device manager, thus rendering my computers ability to use internet useless. Ive tried several things including:1) Simply restarting my computer2) "Show Hidden Devices" in the the device manager3) Ive run command dvcmngr_show_nonpresent_devices (or something very similar to that in system info4) Network Reset5) And finally Factory Reset (with retaining personal files)This issue has caught me by suprise considering the quality of my computer hasnt been an issue until now. Just for context I have a computer starting on Windows 10 OS, so reverting to Windows 7 doesnt appear to be an option
solutions: Hello, I’m Virginia an independent advisor with 20 years of expertise in fixing my own & friends’ PC problems.Which Windows version are you running - 1809, 1903 or 1909? What’s the make & model of the network adapter? Are its drivers up to date? In the end If it is permanently missing then it may be that the adapter/card has failed.
Do you still require help?

solutions: Hi Ashley DotNet Framework errors rarely indicate a problem with the Framework itself, this is nearly always generated by an application installed on your PCIn your case, it is EMSClient by Xink that is causing this error to appear You should uninstall that from Settings - Apps Then if you need that software, download and install the newest version from their website . . .

windows.symptom: Upgrade problem        After updating to win 10 unable to find wi fi connection only offers to connect via ethernet which is not possible
solutions: Hi John Do you mean you upgraded from a previous version of Windows 10, if so, did you then install whatever device drivers Windows 10 could not find during that upgrade?Open Device Manager (accessible by right clicking your Start Button) Expand the Network Adapters section Do you see your WiFi card (WirelessLan) listed in that section, and does that or any other devices have an exclamation mark beside it?What is the Make and exact Model No. of your PC - that will be printed on a sticker on the bottom casing . . .

Hi Johnhoner1,Have you checked all the required drivers on you PC as suggested by DaveM121? If no drivers are installed, if you can't connect to the internet, connect your PC to the router via the WLAN cable. Your PC should be able to recognize the connection, and it will connect to the internet automatically. Upon connection, you'll be asked to enter the security keys of you WiFi router.When you have access to the internet, update the missing drivers required by your PC. Upon updating, the WiFi drivers will be downloaded. After the download is complete, disconnect the cable and see if the WiFi network bars on your PC appear.

windows.symptom: Remove OneDrive and Email Account on Windows for Office365 Account I No Longer Have Access To        I was a contractor for a company, and they gave me an office 365 email address and one drive account that I used on my computer. I've since ended my contract with that company, and no longer have access to that office365 account. However, I can't remove the onedrive or account from my computer, resulting in warnings under email and accounts and onedrive.When I click on manage under email and accounts, it takes me to https://account.activedirectory.windowsazure.com/r/#/profile, which I can't login to because I don't have access to the email. I have already deleted it from control panel/email. With onedrive, I can close it, but I have to do that every time the PC boots. If I go to settings, it again requires logging into an account I can't access. How can I resolve this?

Getting weird screen then freezes up        My computer is less then 2 weeks old and I got this message that covered the whole page and wouldn't let me do anything, it said bbleaguez.club port 443 telling me to contact them at Microsoft I am not giving out my password please help
solutions: Hi, I'm David an independent advisor and user just like you. I'll do my best to help you with this.Sounds a lot like your computer is displaying a fake support message - as you've mentioned you should definitely ignore it and not enter any details or download any offered "fixes", etc.The message will be in a full-screen browser window - first thing you need to do is try and close it if it's still on screen.To do that try pressing CTRL-ALT-DEL, and choose "Task Manager". If you're able to get the list of tasks displayed look for any that mention a browser {(Edge, Chrome, Firefox, etc.) and try and End them. Once you hit the right one the message should disappear.In addition to that - or if you can get the message to disappear restarting the computer will usually clear it for the moment. Again press CTRL-ALT-KEY keys and use the power symbol at the bottom-right to choose RESTART.Once you get the message cleared run a scan with Windows Defender just to be sure there's nothing left over. START > Settings (cog symbol) > Update & Security > Windows Security > Virus & Threat protection. From there choose Quick Scan and wait for the results.Regards, David

And to prevent even getting these fake, so-called Tech Support warnings: install a good ad and tracking blocker...I use and recommend the free extensions uBlock Origin and Ghostery.Most browsers offer the same or similar extensions...  Also go through your browser's settings and adjust them to your wishes. For example, block 3rd party cookies etc.You might want to read: How to tighten security and increase privacy on your browser - Malwarebytes Labs | Malwarebytes Labs  and Answers to common security questions - Best Practicesespecially Beware of Phony Emails, Phone Calls & Tech Support Scamswhich explains various methods how to get out of those fake alerts etcincludes Resources to protect your browser, privacy & help prevent browser pop-up ads and scamsexplains what to do when you keep on seeing these fake sites despite having followed the above mentioned advices.

windows.symptom: OneNote Screenshot        I am trying to find where One Note puts the screenshot.
solutions: Hello gailg494, my name is Farah and I'm an Independent Adviser. I can help you regarding this problemDo you mean the backups or saved files? windows.symptom: Windows Hello error 0x801c004d        HiI am unable to enroll by laptop to use a PIN for login.I receive this error, 0x801c004d. This error is not listed on Microsoft's site.I have enable pin login, taken ownership of the ngc folder. Including several other options. The issue persists.Any ideas?Thank you***Moved From: Windows 10/Security & privacy***
solutions: Hi Adam,Thank you for writing to Microsoft Community Forums.I appreciate the troubleshooting you have done and let us know what other troubleshooting steps you have performed.In order to get clarity on this issue and assist you with appropriate troubleshooting steps, please reply with the answers to the questions below.Are you setting up PIN for the first time?What is the complete error message that you get when you try to add the PIN?Are you aware of any changes made to this computer prior to the issue?Meanwhile, try the below methods and check if this helps.Method 1: Checking for Windows Updates.Check if your Windows is up-to-date by going toSettings > Update and Security > Windows Updates and install all the Windows Updates if there are any.Restart the computer once after installing the updates and check if you are able to add the PIN.If you are getting the same error after installing the Windows Updates, then followMethod 2.Method 2: Checking The CNG Key Isolation Service.Please check if CNG Key Isolation Service is running and theStartup type is set to Automatic by following the below steps.Press the Windows and R keys > TypeServices.msc > Hit Enter.Look for CNG Key Isolation service > Double-click on the service > Change the Startup type toAutomatic > Start the service > Click on Apply > OK.Restart the computer once and check if you are able to add the PIN.If you are getting the same error after Starting this service, then followMethod 3.Method 3: Creating New User Account.If the above methods are not working, then I suggest you to create a new user account by following the steps fromCreate a local user or administrator account in Windows 10 and check if you are able to add the PIN from this new user account.Note: Your user data will be inC:\Users\YourUserName.If you have additional questions, or if the issue persists after performing the above troubleshooting steps, please let me know by replying to this thread. This way, I'll get notified and respond back to you as soon as I can.
Hi ShafeeqI have the latest Windows update patches installedThe CNG service configuration has not helped and I have confirmed it is runningI have tried a new account and get the same issueThank you
HiAny other suggestions?
Hi Team,Any *Suggestion on  0x801c004d this error?
subjugate means literally "bring under the yoke".This error is related to a configuration issue in ADFS, Device Registration

I'm having the exact same problem, tried all those exact same steps, and continue to have the same problem. This hasn't been updated in a week. Does anyone have any other articles to reference or suggestions?
Try following the steps outlined in this article, just the one pagehttps://docs.microsoft.com/en-za/windows-server/identity/ad-fs/operations/configure-device-based-conditional-access-on-premises
Thank you for the comment. But issue is is few machines. Not for all.
Read the entire post...

windows.symptom: Unable to Download Standard PDF's Anymore        Hello,I used to be able to download PDF's (Not web-version Adobe Acrobate files) from Quickbooks directly to my laptop, then I was able to attach the PDF in an email; but for the past couple months, my clients are telling me they cannot open the Adobe Acrobat Files it has been sending out instead of the PDF's like it used to.I had other members of our company send out the PDF's from their computer, because they are still able to successfully download the PDF from Quickbooks and attach it in an email to send to our clients.Does anyone know what this could be? Thanks so much in advance for your help.--Nick Foster
solutions: When you create your PDF can you save it and try to open it yourself.Please check the version and build of Windows 10, type winver in Search and select the top result. Post a screenshot of the result or quote the version and build in full.

Hello Nicholas, thank you for providing this question. I am a seasoned Windows expert with almost a decade in usage and support experience and hope to resolve your problems quickly.What program did you use to download export the pdf? Which filetype do you get? Can you open the downloaded file yourself using a pdf reader? When in acrobat having the file open can you export the file to a new pdf? If you consider your problem solved it would be very good if you marked the answer which helped you so others can find and use this thread.If this didn't solve your problem or you need further assistance please answer in this thread and i would be happy to help.kind regards F. Grobusch
Does this help?

It does in the sense it tells me you are up to date with Windows 10.Can you let us know about the other question and does QuickBooks create the PDF report for you. Is your version of QuickBooks the same as your colleagues. Is their Windows 10 using the same version & build as yours.

Thank you for your willingness to help!The filetype is: Adobe Acrobat File; This is the sign of the issue, because when it was working previously, it used to allow me to use filetype: PDF. The Adobe Acrobate File type is formatted in a much different way, and my clients aren't even able to view it. Prior to this, I am not sure how the settings were originally; I must have inadvertently changed the program or settings?I am able to open these documents myself, but it is very bulky; it does not just show the document, but also shows a bunch of other content(See photo I attached). Thank you for helping me through this!

Corect, all of our quickbooks are up to date; 1 other user uses Windows (he is still able to download PDF's properly) and our other users use Mac (They are still able to download PDF's properly as well) so something tells me I must have inadvertently messed with a setting, perhaps?
On the right side you see: "Export PDF". What happens when you click that?

Unless I'm misunderstanding what QuickBooks is doing I would think it creates a PDF file for the report. What you use on a PC, Tablet, Phone or other device (like a Mac) depends on what program or app you use to open the PDF file and not how it is create.If you installed Adobe Acrobat on your PC and set it as the default to read PDF files then that would open the PDF if you saved it to your PC. The fact that other people, using a Mac can complete the task would suggest a setting has changed in QuickBooks rather than Windows 10.Can you create the report and save it then get it to a Mac user to see how it opens what you have created on your PC. Can you describe the process you go through to create the report, does it print to a PDF for example.
When I click "Export PDF", I am given a list of options; PNG, .doc, .docx, JPEG, powerpoint, .xlsx, .rft, and .tiff

It does save it as an Adobe Acrobat file for me, however my clients are unable to open that document (however, they used to be able to view the PDF when the filetype was PDF instead of Adobe Acrobat file). When I open it, I see a lot more clutter than just the document; some sort of web version.The process is as follows:1.) Create an estimate2.) Dowload the estimate to my computer3.) Select the File Type and Location to Save it to (Only Allows Adobe Acrobate File instead of how it used to save as filetype PDF)4.) Save.thank you so much in advance for your time and help

windows.symptom: custom fonts        I wish to make a custom font i downloaded online my default font. The font in question is "Rogue Hero Regular" the reason for this font is i wish to make my laptop deadpool themed. Yet when i set it as my "default font" through the .reg method it still reverses back to orignal/back up font. How do i allow my laptop to support said font so it can be my default font?
solutions: Hello! My name is Marco, I am an Independent Advisor. I will do my best to help you.Did you do this installation method? Unzip the folder containing the fonts first. Fonts cannot be installed if they are zipped.Right click on the font file and select Install. OR Search for Fonts in the search box by the start menu. Click on the Fonts (Control Panel) link to open the Fonts Manager Drag and Drop or Copy and Paste the unzipped fonts into the Fonts Manager to install.Then you go to the windows settings and personalization and "font"

Sor i believe you do not understand i wish for it to be my systems default font where its the font for my files/taskbar/apps the when added to the regristry as a .reg just sets it to a replacement font instead of the font i want on my system because it was not preinstalled by windows system

Is that how you changed it? -----> Take care to make a backup of your registry before <----- Step 1: Launch the Control Panel from the Start Menu. Step 2: Click on the “Appearance and Personalization” option from the side menu. Step 3: Click on “Fonts” to open fonts and select the name of the one you want to use as default.Step 4: Now open the Notepad application and paste the following code into the empty text file:Windows Registry Editor Version 5.00[HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Fonts]"Segoe UI (TrueType)"="""Segoe UI Bold (TrueType)"="""Segoe UI Bold Italic (TrueType)"="""Segoe UI Italic (TrueType)"="""Segoe UI Light (TrueType)"="""Segoe UI Semibold (TrueType)"="""Segoe UI Symbol (TrueType)"=""[HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\FontSubstitutes]"Segoe UI"="ENTER-NEW-FONT-NAME"Step 5: In registry code above, make sure to replace ENTER-NEW-FONT-NAME with the name of the font you want to use like Courier New.Step 6: Click on File on the top menu options and then save your file as a .reg file by using the extension option “All files”Step 7: From wherever your file is saved, double-click on it to merge it with the registry by clicking Yes and OKStep 8: Simply restart your computer to let the changes take effect

windows.symptom: Windows 10 update v1903        Unable to update my Aspire one 1-431 laptop. The update continually fails s it requires about 8GB to install and my laptop is unable to meet this requirement. I have stripped out all additional apps other that the windows installed ones, deleted any items in the recycle bin done disk clean and fragmentation and optimisation. Suggestions?
solutions: Hi Ethan, you would be amazed how many users with 32GB (29.1GB usable) of internal storage ask the exact same question here on Community each day . . .Honestly, there is only one answer, backup your data and perform a clean install of the 32Bit version of Windows 10 - that will give you more internal storage space - I know this is not the answer you are looking for, but it is the only and best Answer. You will then have enough space for the next year of Windows 10 updates and your system will be faster . ..Any device with a 32 GB SSD is not good enough to run Windows 10, regardless of the system specs put out by Microsoft.I honestly don't know why the manufacturers produced these devices. The Windows 10 folder with a couple of updates will very quickly eat up 20 - 25GB of your hard drive, mine is currently 23GBYou can reinstall Windows 10 at any time and it will not cost you anything, however you will not have enough space to create the bootable Windows 10 media, you will need to do that on another working PCSince you previously had Windows 10 installed and activated on that PC during the installation process skip the steps which ask for a product key and select the option 'I am Reinstalling Windows 10 on this PC', and activation will not be an issue, your PC will have a digital entitlement stored on the Microsoft Activation Servers Make sure you install the same Edition of Windows 10 (Home, Pro . . . etc.) you previously had installed to avoid Activation issuesClick this link: https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/software-downlo...to download the Media Creation Tool (Click on Download Tool Now), with that you can download the latest Windows 10 ISO (Select Create Installation Media for Another PC), you can create a bootable USB flash drive (min 8GB) using that toolThen, Boot your PC from the Installation Media you just created (change Boot Order in your BIOS) to begin installing Windows 10
